item.title: Allyson add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Love consists of this: two solitudes that meet, protect and greet each other. " -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "There's always world enough and time." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Allyson add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Allyson add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Here we are, trapped in the amber of the moment. There is no why." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The universe is a big place, perhaps the biggest." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The point of marriage is not to create a quick commonality by tearing down all boundaries; on the contrary, a good marriage is one in which each partner appoints the other to be the guardian of his solitude, and thus they show each other the greatest possible trust. A merging of two people is an impossibility, and where it seems to exist, it is a hemming-in, a mutual consent that robs one party or both parties of their fullest freedom and development. But once the realization is accepted that even between the closest people infinite distances exist, a marvelous living side-by-side can grow up for them, if they succeed in loving the expanse between them, which gives them the possibility of always seeing each other as a whole and before an immense sky." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "For one human being to love another human being: that is perhaps the most difficult task that has been given to us, the ultimate, the final problem and proof, the work for which all other work is merely preparation." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "What sane person could live in this world and not be crazy?" -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Truth is a matter of the imagination." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Go then, there are other worlds than these." -- Stephen King

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "But because truly being here is so much; because everything here apparently needs us, this fleeting world, which in some strange way keeps calling to us. Us, the most fleeting of all." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Allyson add a quote by T.S. Eliot.
item.description: "There will be time, there will be time To prepare a face to meet the faces that you meet." -- T.S. Eliot.

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Oliver Sacks
item.description: "Every act of perception, is to some degree an act of creation, and every act of memory is to some degree an act of imagination." -- Oliver Sacks

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "This is very important -- to take leisure time. Pace is the essence. Without stopping entirely and doing nothing at all for great periods, you're gonna lose everything...just to do nothing at all, very, very important. And how many people do this in modern society? Very few. That's why they're all totally mad, frustrated, angry and hateful." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Judith Butler
item.description: "Let's face it. We're undone by each other. And if we're not, we're missing something. If this seems so clearly the case with grief, it is only because it was already the case with desire. One does not always stay intact. It may be that one wants to, or does, but it may also be that despite one's best efforts, one is undone, in the face of the other, by the touch, by the scent, by the feel, by the prospect of the touch, by the memory of the feel. And so when we speak about my sexuality or my gender, as we do (and as we must), we mean something complicated by it. Neither of these is precisely a possession, but both are to be understood as modes of being dispossessed, ways of being for another, or, indeed, by virtue of another." -- Judith Butler

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Donna Haraway
item.description: "By the late twentieth century, our time, a mythic time, we are all chimeras, theorized and fabricated hybrids of machine and organism; in short, we are cyborgs." -- Donna Haraway

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "Knowledge is not for knowing: knowledge is for cutting." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "The imaginary is not formed in opposition to reality as its denial or compensation; it grows among signs, from book to book, in the interstice of repetitions and commentaries; it is born and takes shape in the interval between books. It is the phenomena of the library." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Love is the expression of the one who loves, not of the one who is loved. Those who think they can love only the people they prefer do not love at all. Love discovers truths about individuals that others cannot see" -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Allyson add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "After one look at this planet any visitor from outer space would say 'I want to see the manager." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "We're all going to die, all of us, what a circus! That alone should make us love each other but it doesn't. We are terrorized and flattened by trivialities, we are eaten up by nothing." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "there is a loneliness in this world so great that you can see it in the slow movement of the hands of a clock" -- Charles Bukowski
